Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2010 07:08PM KinAZ wrote: Hi, I had a bilateral mx with expander placement and snb..my surgery was long and i had severe pain from nerve damage, with numbing in my thumb, index and middle finger which extended into my wrist.....with time the nerve pain in the upper arm went away, but the numbing never has...my surgery was oct 8 2008....the drs. insisted it would get better, but it never has...i saw a neurologist, did physical therapy, and no change....i have learned to live with it, but have to be careful not to burn those fingers, and i find i drop things alot....through my research and a chat with my breast surgeon, i believe it was caused from the snb...dr said that 1 of the nodes was very deep and and near the brachial nerve....google nerve damage after mx....i do hope you can find relief,  it is just 1 more thing to deal with that makes this journey neverending best of luck with your diep.....just had mine mar 10 2010, and love the girlz..take care karen
Posts.Title: forearm and hand numbness 9 mos out! amym159 amym159

Posts.Content: May 6, 2008 11:07AM KinAZ wrote: I just went through that in Feb.  My gyn oncol  told me I could drive as soon as I was off pain meds, which was only about 5 days.  I went home the day after surgery and returned to work the 3rd week on a part time basis as I was still tired.  I hope your procedure goes smoothly and quickly!!!! Karen
Posts.Title: abdominal ooph and hyst recovery time flash HeatherBLocklear

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2011 12:43AM KinAZ wrote: Mocha,,,I have been there ...Had a bilat mx with tissue expanders, had problems with seromas and had the expanders removed 2 months after mx due to infection.  waited to heal totally which took 3 months and then ps put the expanders back in....had no problems...the first time my breast exploded I was sure it was the expander...no way could that much fluid have been inside me...but it was!!!! A year later I had diep reconstruction, and had problems on the other foob,,,wound would not heal, had to have my dh and cousin pack it for me and ended up with a wound vac which helped a great deal, although it was cumbersome and downright annoying it helped me heal.....Our bodies go through so much, and sometimes it takes longer to heal than we think it should.....I thought it would never end but it did....just hang in there.  I know how difficult it can be, and I am sorry your having such a tough time. Hugs to you, Karen
Posts.Title: trouble after surgery mocha1227 KinAZ

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2010 11:12PM KinAZ wrote: i am also a stage 2 with microscopic lymph involvement and was also told scans would not be standard follow up care...i have had a few scares and they were very quick to order the appropriate scans....no bloodwork because there are too many false positives, my onco said it is not a reliable indicator and creates unneeded anxiety.   i notice that you are a triple negative, and i think that might change things a bit, maybe check the triple neg thread, and be sure to discuss this with the onco..best of luck karen
Posts.Title: Stage II - No scans?? SunnyCoconut Tabatha00

Posts.Content: May 17, 2008 07:48AM KinAZ wrote: Hi to All, I will be starting chemo May 22nd....I am just glad to get going.  Was dx in Mar and wont have surgery till after chemo....Surgery was rescheduled for July but I dont want to wait any longer....so we are doing chemo first. Sounds like a long hot summer ahead.  Dont know if I want a wig or not.... maybe better to get it and not use it, than to want it and not have it.  Nothing is easy about any of this. I am glad to have all of you here, altho I wish none of use were here!  Have a good weekend Karen
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2008 KristyAnn Nico1012

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2010 09:46AM KinAZ wrote: Hi,  I also had 3 tumors  IDC, had biopsy on 2 of them....the 3rd was to small to get...mine were also in different quadrants, so lumpectomy was not an option.....i was her2 neg, but did not get that info until after surgery.....it was in the pathology report.. i also had no lymph node involvement found in the O.R.  from the sentinal node biopsy,,but,,, after the lab had a closer look, microinvasion was found in 1 lymph node.......i understand your anxiety about the her2 results, so call the onco office and ask them about the biopsy info they have...request a copy of the report, and be sure to let them know your feelings....they may not be aware!!!  My entire team was very responsive when I presented issues that were bothering me...so even tho I had 3 tumors I was her2 neg...and only grade 2....best of luck, and feel free to pm me...I know this is a tough time, but you will find strength you did not know you had!!!   many hugs to you, karen
Posts.Title: 3 tumors in one breast--no Her2 test done yet Joanne58 dlb823

Posts.Content: May 31, 2011 09:54PM KinAZ wrote: wow....just had my 6 month follow up at onco today, and i have been telling them all along, the fatique and fogginess is NOT better.....after 2 1/2 yrs, i was finally told what i already knew...lol....some people have permanent chemo brain....its not just from the arimidex, nor depression, or any other dx thrown at me...well duh, ,, last month i headed to walmart....been going there for 12 yrs, and it is 2 streets away, only 3 miles from my house....i could not find it, absolutely could not remember where it was,,,,,and had even driven past it...i had to call my dh to find out where it was....so glad he is understanding.  some days its funny, some days frustrating.
Posts.Title: Humor - Chemo brain 3 years later JeninMichigan KinAZ

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2009 06:38PM KinAZ wrote: I had a 28cm ovarian tumor removed..........huge.........it was a borderline serous tumor, not considerd cancerous or normal...........so it was treated as cancer, which meant a complete hysterectomy.  I found a great sight, much like this hystersisters.com best of luck to you

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2009 03:36PM KinAZ wrote: Shabby,  You have alot going on right now.  The emotions can be overwhelming, we know.  The worst part of my journey with bc was the beginning, right where you are now.  And the waiting is a nightmare.  Dealing with the unknown can be worse than dealing with bc.  I got to the point where I just stayed off the internet, because it only added to my anxiety.  Be sure to read the positive threads here.  They can be calming and helpful.  We understand what your going through.  Your in my prayers.  Keep us posted! Hugs Karen
